back: .NET is a free, open-source developer platform for building applications on Windows, Linux, and macOS.
Common Language Runtime manages memory, security, exception handling, and execution of .NET programs.
Common Type System defines how data types are declared and used in .NET.
Common Language Specification defines rules for language interoperability in .NET.
Just-In-Time compiler converts IL code into native machine code at runtime.
Intermediate Language is CPU-independent code generated by .NET compilers.
Code executed under CLR with automatic memory management.
Code that runs outside the CLR without garbage collection.
Automatic memory management that reclaims unused objects.
A compiled unit of code in .NET containing IL, metadata, and resources.
Global Assembly Cache stores shared .NET assemblies.
A logical grouping of related classes and interfaces.
Object-Oriented Programming includes Encapsulation, Inheritance, Polymorphism, and Abstraction.
Hiding internal data and exposing behavior through methods.
Mechanism to derive a new class from an existing class.
Ability of an object to take multiple forms.
Showing only essential features and hiding implementation details.
A contract that defines method signatures without implementation.
A class that cannot be instantiated and may contain abstract methods.
A design pattern that injects dependencies instead of creating them.
Software components that process HTTP requests in ASP.NET Core pipeline.
Cross-platform framework for building web applications and APIs.
Model-View-Controller pattern separates application concerns.
A markup syntax for embedding C# in HTML.
Framework for building RESTful HTTP services in .NET.
ORM framework for database access using C# objects.
Language Integrated Query for querying data sources.
Primary class in EF for interacting with database.
Mechanism to update database schema using code.
Programming model using async and await for non-blocking operations.
Represents an asynchronous operation.
Collection of reusable threads managed by .NET.
JSON Web Token used for secure authentication.
Authorization framework for secure API access.
Recording application events for monitoring and debugging.
Framework component that manages object lifetimes and dependencies.
Testing individual components of application.
Popular testing framework for .NET.
Package manager for .NET libraries.
Build system used for compiling .NET projects.
Cross-platform web server for ASP.NET Core.
